Name_En:
Several countries still report their production by large groups of species. In these circumstances the data presented by individual species items are likely to be underestimated. Therefore, when examining the statistics for a particular species, it should be noted that an unknown proportion of the production for that species might have been reported by the national office under the generic, family or order name of the species, or even more roughly as 'fishes not identified'. Consequently, species item totals frequently underestimate the real production of the individual species.

Starting with the release of March 2003, capture and aquaculture production statistics have been extended back to 1950. Data before 1970 in respect to certain species may be subject to further improvements.
Name_Es:
Varios países siguen informando sobre la producción por grandes grupos de especies. En estos casos, es probable que aparezcan subestimados los datos sobre la producción de las partidas de especies. Por consiguiente, al examinar las estadísticas de una especie particular, debe tenerse en cuenta que una proporción desconocida de la producción de esa especie puede haber sido ya comunicada por la oficina nacional con el nombre genérico, el de familia o el del orden de la especie, o incluso más aproximativamente como "peces no identificados". En consecuencia, los totales de las partidas de especies subestiman frecuentemente la producción efectiva de la especie individual.

A partir de la versión de marzo de 2003, las estadísticas de la producción de capturas y acuicultura se han extendido hasta 1950. Los datos sobre algunas especies antes de 1970 están siendo examinados para una posible rectificación.
Name_Fr:
Plusieurs pays continuent à communiquer leur production par grands groupes d'espèces. Dans ces circonstances les données de production par catégories d'espèces individuelles sont donc probablement sous-estimées. Par conséquent, lorsqu'on examine les statistiques d'une espèce donnée, il convient de noter qu'une proportion inconnue de la production de cette espèce peut avoir été consignée par l'organisme national sous le nom du genre, de la famille ou de l'ordre de l'espèce, ou même, plus approximativement dans la catégorie "poissons non identifiés". C'est pourquoi que les totaux correspondant aux espèces données sous-estiment souvent la production réelle de chacune des espèces.

À partir de la version datée 'mars 2003', les données statistiques concernant les captures et l'aquaculture ont été étendues jusqu'en 1950. Les données avant 1970, pour ce qui concerne certaines espèces, peuvent être sujettes à des améliorations ultérieures.

Name_En: Where necessary, any data published in previous releases of this dataset have been revised. Where the figures in the current release differ from those previously published, the amended data represent the most recent version. Some statistics provided to FAO by national offices, in particular those for the last year, are provisional and may be amended in future editions.
Name_Es: Le cas échéant, les données déjà publiées dans des éditions précédentes de cette base de données ont été révisées. Lorsque les chiffres indiqués dans l'édition présente diffèrent de ceux publiés précédemment, les données modifiées représentent la version la plus récente. Certaines statistiques communiquées à la FAO par les services nationaux sont provisoires, notamment pour la dernière année, et pourront être modifiées dans les éditions futures.
Name_Fr: Siempre que ha sido necesario se han revisado los datos ya publicados en las ediciones anteriores del este banco de datos. Cuando las cifras que aparecen en esta edición difieren de las publicadas anteriormente, los nuevos datos representan la última versión disponible. Algunas estadísticas facilitadas a la FAO por las oficinas nacionales, en particular las correspondientes al último año, son provisionales y podrán modificarse en ediciones futuras y en otras publicaciones de la FAO.

Name_En:
To facilitate the reporting of consistent and accurate world capture and aquaculture production statistics, FAO/NFISS provides internationally agreed criteria for separating statistics of capture and aquaculture.
FAO provides internationally agreed definitions in the "CWP Handbook of Fisheries Statistics", which includes comprehensive definitions of concepts and details of standard classifications (https://www.fao.org/cwp-on-fishery-statistics/handbook/en/).

NB: When viewing time-series data in FishStatJ, in order to obtain the same aggregates presented in the Summary Tables of the "FAO Yearbook of Fishery and Aquaculture Statistics" which exclude production figures for marine mammals, crocodiles, corals, pearls, mother-of-pearl, sponges and aquatic plants, you must first filter the dataset using a Custom Group:

1. Open the Filter Dialog Box (Data/Filter or F4).
2. Click the [Species] tab.
3. Click the Groups combo box and select [Yearbook/SOFIA].
4. Click [Fish, crustaceans, molluscs, etc].
5. Click the single left arrow in order to move under the "Include" left panel all selected species belonging to [Fish, crustaceans, molluscs, etc].
6. Click [OK]. The program will return you to the Main Window.

A break in the time series for a particular species item could be generated by a change in the national classification or re-identification of the species which should be considered as an improvement in data reporting. Several countries still report their aquaculture production by large groups of species. In these circumstances the data presented by individual species items are likely to be underestimated.
Name_Es: Un cambio en la clasificación nacional o la reidentificación de la especie podría generar una ruptura en la serie temporal para una partida de especie en particular, lo que debería considerarse como una mejora en la notificación de datos. Varios países aún reportan su producción acuícola por grandes grupos de especies. En estas circunstancias, es probable que se subestimen los datos presentados por una partida de especie individual.
Name_Fr: Une rupture dans la série chronologique pour une espèce particulière pourrait être générée par un changement dans la classification nationale ou la ré-identification de l'espèce qui devrait être considérée comme une amélioration de la communication des données. Plusieurs pays déclarent encore leur production aquacole par grands groupes d'espèces. Dans ces circonstances, les données présentées par espèces individuelles sont susceptibles d'être sous-estimées.

Name_En: Capture and aquaculture production quantities have a high cross-domain coherence, as data are used as inputs in the fish food balance sheets (FBS), which serves as an additional validation of the data in a single supply and utilization framework.
Name_Es: Las cantidades de capturas y producción acuícola tienen una alta coherencia entre dominios, ya que los datos se utilizan como entradas en las hojas de balance de alimentos para peces (FBS), lo que sirve como una validación adicional de los datos en un marco único de suministro y utilización.
Name_Fr: Les quantités de captures et aquaculture ont une cohérence interdomaine élevée, car les données sont utilisées comme entrées dans les bilans alimentaires des poissons (FBS), qui servent de validation supplémentaire des données dans un cadre unique d'approvisionnement et d'utilisation.

Name_En:
Fish, crustaceans, molluscs and all other aquatic organisms included in the dataset have been classified according to species items, further arranged within the 50 groups of species constituting the nine divisions of the FAO International Standard Statistical Classification of Aquatic Animals and Plants (ISSCAAP). The descriptors are taken from the " ASFIS list of species for fishery statistics purposes" (version 2021). Please note that the list of species disseminated in these datasets might not adhere entirely to ASFIS (version 2021) due to differing publication schedules.

https://www.fao.org/fishery/static/ASFIS/ISSCAAP.pdf
https://www.fao.org/fishery/en/collection/asfis

The list of countries and the geographical classification are primarily based on the UN "STANDARD COUNTRY OR AREA CODES FOR STATISTICAL USE" (https://unstats.un.org/unsd/methodology/m49/).

Additional country classifications available in this Workspace are based on a variety of sources. Here below the main ones:
- Least Developed Countries (LDC) (version 2021) (https://www.un.org/development/desa/dpad/wp-content/uploads/sites/45/publication/ldc_list.pdf)
- Low-Income Food-Deficit Countries (LIFDCs) (2021 revision)(https://www.fao.org/countryprofiles/lifdc/en/)
- Land-Locked Developing Countries (LLDCs) (https://unctad.org/topic/landlocked-developing-countries/list-of-LLDCs)
- Small Island Developing States (SIDS) (https://www.un.org/ohrlls/content/list-sids)
- Net Food-Importing Developing Countries(NFIDC) (2021 revision) (https://docs.wto.org/dol2fe/Pages/SS/directdoc.aspx?filename=q:/G/AG/5R11.pdf&Open=True2021)
- The classification of the World Bank by income (2022 revision) (https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups)

The production is also classified according to the inland or marine area where production took place. These are divided into eight major inland fishing areas and 19 major marine fishing areas, internationally established for fishery statistical purposes (https://www.fao.org/cwp-on-fishery-statistics/handbook/general-concepts/main-water-areas/en/).
Name_Es:
Los peces, crustáceos, moluscos y todos los demás organismos acuáticos incluidos en la base de datos se han clasificado por  partidas de especies , agrupadas dentro de los 50 grupos de especies que constituyen las nueve divisiones de la Clasificación Estadística Internacional Uniforme de los Animales y Plantas Acuáticos (CEIUAPA) de la FAO.
Los descriptores se han tomado de la «Lista ASFIS de especies para los fines de estadísticas de pesca» (versión 2021). Por favor se tenga en cuenta que la lista de especies utilizada en estos conjuntos de datos puede no corresponder completamente a ASFIS (versión 2021) debido a diferentes fechas de publicación.

https://www.fao.org/fishery/static/ASFIS/ISSCAAP.pdf
https://www.fao.org/fishery/en/collection/asfis

La lista de países y la clasificación geográfica se basan principalmente en los "CÓDIGOS ESTÁNDAR DE PAÍS O ÁREA PARA USO ESTADÍSTICO" de la ONU (https://unstats.un.org/unsd/methodology/m49/).

Las clasificaciones de países adicionales disponibles en este espacio de trabajo se basan en una variedad de fuentes. Aquí abajo los principales:
- Países menos adelantados (revisión de 2021) (PMA) (https://www.un.org/development/desa/dpad/wp-content/uploads/sites/45/publication/ldc_list.pdf)
- Países de bajos ingresos y con déficit de alimentos (PBIDA) (revisión de 2021) (https://www.fao.org/countryprofiles/lifdc/es/)
- Países en desarrollo sin litoral (PDSL) (https://unctad.org/topic/landlocked-developing-countries/list-of-LLDCs)
- Pequeños Estados insulares en desarrollo (PEID) (https://www.un.org/ohrlls/content/list-sids)
- Países en desarrollo importadores netos de alimentos (revisión de 2021) (https://docs.wto.org/dol2fe/Pages/SS/directdoc.aspx?filename=q:/G/AG/5R11.pdf&Open=True2021)
- La clasificación del Banco Mundial según el nivel de ingresos (revisión de 2022) (https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups)

La producción también se clasifica según el área continental o marina donde tuvo lugar la producción. Estas áreas aparecen clasificados en ocho áreas principales de pesca continental y 19 áreas principales de pesca marina, establecidas internacionalmente a efectos estadísticos (https://www.fao.org/cwp-on-fishery-statistics/handbook/general-concepts/main-water-areas/en/).
Name_Fr:
Les poissons, crustacés, mollusques et autres organismes aquatiques inclus dans le jeu de données sont ventilés par catégories d'espèces, qui sont rassemblées en 50 groupes d'espèces constituant les neuf divisions de la Classification statistique internationale type des animaux et des plantes aquatiques (CSITAPA) de la FAO.
Les descripteurs de code taxonomique proviennent de la «Liste ASFIS des espèces pour les besoins des statistiques des pêches» (version 2021). Veuillez noter que la liste des espèces utilisée dans ces ensembles de données peut ne pas correspondre entièrement à ASFIS(version 2021) en raison de dates de publication différents.

https://www.fao.org/fishery/static/ASFIS/ISSCAAP.pdf
https://www.fao.org/fishery/en/collection/asfis

La liste des pays et la classification géographique sont principalement basées sur les » STANDARD COUNTRY OR AREA CODES FOR STATISTICAL USE » des Nations Unies (https://unstats.un.org/unsd/methodology/m49/).

Les classifications de pays supplémentaires disponibles dans cet espace de travail sont basées sur diverses sources. Ci-dessous les principales:
- Pays les Moins Avancés (PMA) (révision 2021) (https://www.un.org/development/desa/dpad/wp-content/uploads/sites/45/publication/ldc_list.pdf)
- Pays à faible revenu et à déficit vivrier (PFRDV) (révision 2021) (https://www.fao.org/countryprofiles/lifdc/fr/)
- Pays en développement sans littoral (PDSL) (https://unctad.org/topic/landlocked-developing-countries/list-of-LLDCs)
- Petits États insulaires en développement (PIED) (https://www.un.org/ohrlls/content/list-sids)
- Pays en développement importateurs nets de produits alimentaires (révision 2021) (https://docs.wto.org/dol2fe/Pages/SS/directdoc.aspx?filename=q:/G/AG/5R11.pdf&Open=True2021)
- La classification de la Banque mondiale par revenu (révision 2022)(https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups)

La production est également classifiée selon les zones marines ou continentales dans lesquelles la production est effectuée. Celles-ci sont ventilées en huit principales zones de pêche continentales et 19 principales zones de pêche maritimes, définies au niveau international à des fins statistiques (https://www.fao.org/cwp-on-fishery-statistics/handbook/general-concepts/main-water-areas/en/).

Name_En:
Final data have been provided by many national offices; others submitted provisional figures only. Whenever national offices failed to report their annual aquaculture statistics in time for publication, FAO has estimated the quantities and values on the basis of other available information.
Data reported by countries may be supplemented with information from other sources, where available, including regional fishery bodies and arrangements, field projects and independent surveys, academic reviews, specialist literature and fishery-independent sources.
Name_Es:
Muchas oficinas nacionales han facilitado datos definitivos; otras, en cambio, sólo han presentado cifras provisionales. Cuando las oficinas nacionales no han comunicado sus estadísticas nacionales de acuicultura a tiempo para su publicación, la FAO ha
estimado las cantidades y los valores  en base a otra información disponible.
Los datos comunicados por los países son complementados con información de otras procedencias, cuando se dispone, tales como los órganos y disposiciones regionales de pesca, los proyectos de campo y encuestas independientes, estudios de carácter
académico, bibliografía especializada y fuentes que no dependen de la pesca.
Name_Fr:
De nombreux services nationaux ont communiqué des données définitives; d'autres n'ont fourni que des chiffres préliminaires. Chaque fois que les services nationaux n'ont pu déclarer leurs statistiques de l’aquaculture annuelles en temps utile pour la
publication, la FAO a procédé à des estimations pour arriver à des chiffres de volume et valeur plus proches de la réalité sur la base d'autres informations mises à sa disposition.
Les données communiquées par les pays peuvent être complétées par des informations provenant d'autres sources telles que:
organes et arrangements régionaux des pêches, projets de terrain, enquêtes indépendantes, études universitaires, documents rédigés par des spécialistes et sources extérieures au secteur des pêches.

Name_En: The production specifically refers to all catches taken for commercial, industrial, recreational and subsistence purposes from inland, brackish and marine waters, but excluding aquaculture in the area of competence of the Fishery Committee for the Eastern Central Atlantic (CECAF).
Name_Es: La producción se refiere específicamente a  capturas con fines comerciales, industriales, recreativos y de subsistencia de aguas interiores, salobres y marinas, con exclusión de acuicultura en el área de competencia del Comité de Pesca para el Atlántico Centro-Oriental (CPACO).

Name_En:
Fish, crustaceans, molluscs and all other aquatic organisms included in the dataset have been classified according to commercial species items, further arranged within the 50 groups of species constituting the nine divisions of the FAO International Standard Statistical Classification of Aquatic Animals and Plants (ISSCAAP). The taxonomic code descriptors are taken from the " ASFIS list of species for fishery statistics purposes" (version 2021). Please note that the list of species disseminated in these datasets might not adhere entirely to ASFIS(version 2021) due to differing publication schedules.

For statistical purposes the CECAF region, which coincide with the FAO fishing area "34 - Eastern Central Atlantic", has been split into four subareas, further sub-divided into twelve divisions. The boundaries of these subareas and divisions are shown in a map that can be accessed through VIEW/SHOW METADATA/ATTACHMENTS from the main menu. Below is the list of subareas and divisions.

34 1 - NORTHERN COASTAL subarea, which includes three divisions:

34 1 1 - Morocco coastal
34 1 2 - Canaries/Madeira insular
34 1 3 - Sahara coastal
34 2 - NORTHERN OCEANIC subarea, which includes only one divisions:

34 2 0 - Northern oceanic
34 3 - SOUTHERN COASTAL subarea, which includes six divisions:

34 3 1 - Cape Verde coastal
34 3 2 - Cape Verde insular
34 3 3 - Sherbro
34 3 4 - Western Gulf of Guinea
34 3 5 - Central Gulf of Guinea
34 3 6 - Southern Gulf of Guinea
34 4 - SOUTHERN OCEANIC subarea, which includes two divisions:

34 4 1 - Southwest Gulf of Guinea
34 4 2 - Southwest oceanic
Tuna catches are not allocated according to CECAF statistical divisions and are grouped together into a division named "Tunas" (34 0 0). Two other divisions, namely "Northern coastal, not known" (34 1 9) and "Not known" (34 9 0), contain catches for which is not exactly known the statistical division.
Name_Fr:
Les poissons, crustacés, mollusques et autres organismes aquatiques inclus dans le jeu de données sont ventilés en catégories d'espèces commerciales, qui sont rassemblées en 50 groupes d'espèces constituant les neuf divisions de la Classification statistique internationale type des animaux et des plantes aquatiques (CSITAPA) de la FAO.

Les descripteurs de code taxonomique proviennent de la «Liste ASFIS des espèces pour les besoins des statistiques des pêches» (version 2021). Veuillez noter que la liste des espèces utilisée dans ces ensembles de données peut ne pas correspondre entièrement à ASFIS(version 2021) en raison de dates de publication différents.

Pour les besoins statistiques, la région du COPACE, qui correspond à la zone de pêche de la FAO "34 - Atlantique centre-est", a été subdivisée en quatre sous-zones, encore subdivisées en douze divisions et dont les limites sont tracées sur la carte, accessible à partir du menu Visualiser/Montrer les métadonnées/Documents annéxés.

Les sous-zones et les divisions sont les suivantes :

34 1 - La sous-zone CÔTIÈRE NORD, qui regroupe trois divisions, à savoir

34 1 1 - Côtière du Maroc
34 1 2 - Insulaire des Canaries/Madère
34 1 3 - Côtière du Sahara
34 2 - La sous-zone OCÉANIQUE NORD, qui regroupe une seule division, à savoir

34 2 0 - Océanique nord
34 3 - La sous-zone CÔTIÈRE SUD, qui regroupe six divisions, à savoir

34 3 1 - Côtière du Cap-Vert
34 3 2 - Insulaire du Cap-Vert
34 3 3 - Sherbro
34 3 4 - Golfe de Guinée, ouest
34 3 5 - Golfe de Guinée, centre
34 3 6 - Golfe de Guinée, sud
34 4 - La sous-zone OCÉANIQUE SUD, qui regroupe deux divisions, à savoir

34 4 1 - Golfe de Guinée, sud-ouest
34 4 2 - Océanique, sud-ouest
Puisqu'il n'est pas possible de ventiler de façon sûre les prises de thonidés par divisions statistiques, ces prises sont données groupées pour l'entière région du COPACE sous une division appelée "Thons" (34 0 0). Deux autres divisions, "Côtière nord, inconnue" (34 1 9) et "Inconnue" (34 9 0), regroupent les prises dont la division statistique de pêche n'est pas certaine.

Name_En: Catches of fish, crustaceans and molluscs are expressed in live weight, that is the nominal weight of the aquatic organisms at the time of capture. Data are given in tonnes (=1000 kg).
Name_Es: Las capturas de peces, crustáceos y moluscos se expresan en peso en vivo, es decir el peso nominal de los organismos acuáticos en el momento de la captura. Los datos se expresan en toneladas (=1000 kg).
Name_Fr: Les captures de poissons, crustacés et mollusques sont exprimées en poids vif, c'est-à-dire le poids nominal des organismes aquatiques à la capture. Les données sont exprimées en tonnes (=1000 kg).

Name_En: The annual period used is the calendar year (1 January - 31 December), with the exceptions of data for some countries for which a split-year is used. Split-year data are shown under the calendar year in which the split-year ends.
Name_Es: El período anual utilizado es el año civil (1 de enero-31 de diciembre), excepto para algunos países para los que se utiliza el año emergente. Los datos correspondientes a los años emergentes se incluyen en el año civil en que termina el año emergente.
Name_Fr: La période annuelle utilisée est l'année civile (1er janvier-31 décembre), sauf pour quelques pays pour lesquels on utilise l'année fractionnée. Les données relatives aux années fractionnées figurent sous l'année civile durant laquelle se termine l'année fractionnée.

The data refers to annual international trade of fishery commodities since 1976. The fishery trade data is collected and processed by FAO Fisheries Division Statistical Team and refers to fishery commodities imported, exported and re-exported annually by all the countries in the world. The data is mainly provided by UNSD, Eurostat, and other national authorities as needed. When available data on fish landed abroad by domestic vessels is added. This source data is checked for outliers. Non-reporting countries and missing cells are imputed by FAO using trade partner data (i.e. mirror data) in the absence of other information. The dataset is organized by:
- countries, territories or land areas. The country of origin for imports or country of destination for exports are not included in the database.
- trade flow (import, export, re-export)
- fishery commodities included in the "FAO International Standard Statistical Classification of Fishery Commodities" (ISSCFC). Correspondences exist with the Harmonized System (HS), Standard International Trade Classification (SITC), Central Product Classification (CPC), and International Standard Statistical Classification of Aquatic Animals and Plants (ISSCAAP).
- year
The variables included are:
- import quantity
- import value
- export quantity
- export value
- re-export quantity
- re-export value.

Fishery commodities cover products derived from fish, crustaceans, molluscs and other aquatic animals and residues caught for commercial, industrial or subsistence uses, by all types of classes of fishing units operating in inland, fresh and brackish waters, in inshore, offshore or high seas fishing areas. Commodities produced from the raw materials supplied by all kinds of aquaculture are also included.

Two systems of recording trade are in common use: special trade and general trade.
- Special trade is a system of recording imports for domestic consumption on the one hand and exports of domestic goods on the other. Special imports include goods for domestic consumption and withdrawals from bonded warehouses or free zones for purposes of domestic consumption. Special exports comprise exports of goods wholly or partially produced or manufactured in the country, together with exports of “nationalized goods”, but not of goods held in bonded warehouses or free zones.
- General trade is a system which records total imports and total exports including re-exports. General imports consist of all imports into a country, including goods for domestic consumption and imports into bonded warehouses or free zones. General exports consist of the combined total of national exports and re-exports. Re-exports, in the general trade system, consist of the outward movement of nationalized goods plus goods which, after importation, move outward from bonded warehouses or free zones without having been transformed. Export and import data in this dataset relate to general trade for about half of countries and to special trade for the other half. LIST THE COUNTRIES - where do we get this info from? Quantities refer to the net product weight of the commodities. Although data are shown to the nearest tonne, they are not necessarily of this degree of accuracy.

Product weight: The weight of the product excluding the weight of the container and any liquid added for preservation or flavour.

Values are expressed in national currency unit and converted to thousand USD. The conversion is done by applying average annual exchange rates from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) database. Export values are mostly reported as FOB (free on board) and import values as CIF (cost, insurance and freight), unless indicated in country notes.

CIF vs FOB values: International trade statistics apply harmonised principles when compiling the "statistical value" of trade flows. In general, all commodities should be valued with the total amount which would be invoiced in case of sale or purchase at the national border of the reporting country. The statistical value does not include taxes on export or import, such as customs duties, value added tax, excise duty, levies, export refunds or other taxes with similar effect. It includes only incidental expenses (freight, insurance) incurred, in the case of exports, in the part of the journey located on the territory of the reporting Member State and, in the case of imports, in the part of the journey located outside the territory of the reporting country. This can be characterized as an FOB value (free on board) for exports, and a CIF value (cost, insurance, freight) for imports.

FAO trade statistics follow the international standards provided by the IMTS, which is periodically revised by UNSD with the contribution of other international organizations and member countries. The original version was issued in 1970 (United Nations publication, Sales No. E.70.XVII.16) and the first revised version was released in 1982 (United Nations publication, Sales No. E.82.XVII.14). At its forty-first session, the Statistical Commission adopted International Merchandise Trade Statistics: Concepts And Definitions, 2010 (IMTS 2010) and endorsed the proposed implementation programme, including the preparation of the revision of International Merchandise Trade Statistics: Compilers Manual and supporting technical assistance activities (see E/2010/24, chap. I.B, decision 41/103, para. (b)). In the same decision (para. (c)), the Commission requested the Expert Group on International Merchandise Trade Statistics and the Task Force on International Merchandise Trade Statistics to continue their work, focus on the implementation of IMTS 2010 and give due consideration to national circumstances, the harmonization of national and regional compilation practices, and the conduct of related comparison studies. The legal acts concerning trade statistics at national levels are available on the country websites.

The main source of errors is the deviation from the standard IMTS methodology and recommendations in reporting annual trade data by various countries. Incomplete country metadata is another source of errors, especially related to the description of the unit of measurement used at the most detailed level of reported data. Trade data accuracy is affected by specific characteristics such as the practice of concealing confidential information and the exemption thresholds applied by countries in order to reduce the burden on enterprises. The lack of country tariff line description generate various ambiguities on the link between HS and FAO ISSCFC.

The accuracy and comparability of data is very much dependent on practices, definitions and policies in individual countries. These differences often lead to different quantities being reported by the reporting country and the trading partner. The inconsistency between the declaration of the reporter and partner countries could be generated by the trade methodology applied (general trade system versus special trade system, the latter of which is the case of extra-EU trade statistics, for example), by the classification used, by the time laps between the dispatch of goods from the exporting country and their arrival in the importing country, or by the country coverage. Given this underlying situation, the geographical comparability of trade data depends on which countries and groups of countries are compared. For some countries, the comparability is highly consistent. The use of mirror data cross-checking in FAO's validation processes is one manner through which data comparability is evaluated.

A break in the time series for a particular product could be generated by a change in the country classification (such as the splitting of Sudan into Sudan and South Sudan, or the enlargement of the EU) as well as due to the revision of the classification or due to the type of data source used by countries. For shorter periods and when data are compiled according to a singular classification or to the same definitions or source, data over time are fully comparable.

Trade of fishery commodities have a high cross-domain coherence, as data are used as inputs in the fish food balance sheets (FBS), which serves as an additional validation of the data in a single supply and utilization framework. In addition, fish trade data is coherent with FAO non-fish trade data as they are based on the HS classification.

Fishery commodities are coded using the FAO International Standard Statistical Classification of Fishery Commodities (ISSCFC), which is derived from the United Nations Standard International Trade Classification, Revision 4 (SITC Rev. 4) and linked to the Harmonized System and Coding System of the World Customs Organization (formerly the Custom Co-operation Council) and to the FAOSTAT classification. The FAO ISSCFC is available at: http://www.fao.org/3/a-bt967e.pdf. Correspondences exist between the ISSCFC and the following classifications: HS, ISSCAAP, FAOSTAT groups, SITC and CPC.

The main source is official country statistics compiled by UNSD, TDM? and Eurostat.
